correct.text: This is a spam email. The best way to discern that is looking at the sender of the email, which is not a valid support email.

This is a spam email. The sender email looks quite convincing, but it is always worth it to hover over the link. Furthermore, sign-in emails should not come from a news email, or from the Nokia group in Finland.

Yes, this a spam email. The sender of the email looks legitimate, but the 'mailto:' prefix often gives away that a script was used to send the email. In addition, hovering over the link reveals that the link does not go directly to zoom but to ydd.efe, an unknown URL. This is a very convincing spam email, beware!
Yes, this a spam email. The sender of the email does not match USPS emails. This email is extra dangerous as the whole email is masqueraded to be a link.

title: How well can you identify spam mail?
